moves.6... Nf6: a main idea:  delaying d6 to stay in accelerated territory.
moves.7. Qd2:
(?) This is the theoretical trap. White wants to play a yugoslav attack, but fails to use the correct move order to play it. The traditional yugoslav may be fine this way, but here it is a mistake. Another mistake is 7.f3?! 0-0  8.Qd2 d5!  and 7.f3?! 0-0  8.Bc4?! Qb6! in these lines black immediately steals the advantage. They both score an impressive 70% for black. The 2 best moves here are: 
1.Classical variation with Be2  2.Correct yugoslav attack with Bc4! followed by Bb3!. Only then will f3, Qd2 and 0-0-0 be played, with an attack.
